activities: Envision Pharma Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates may receive a number of different types of data from the EEA including data about: employees, potential employees, and their family members; consultants; employees and consultants of clients; authors; clinical and medical investigators and staff conducting clinical and medical research; clinical study participants; patient data; investors and shareholders.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resource/Employee Details, client/client employee, consultant, author, medical investigator, clinical trial participant, clinical trial data, patient data, including manually processed data
recoursemech: American Arbitration Association (ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program) for non-human resources data: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for HR data only
